recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Sambhar is a vegetable stew made with pigeon peas (toor dal) and tamarind. It is a very famous dish in Southern India and each state has its different ways to prepare it.
Toor dal is initially boiled and after which tamarind, veggies are added. Curry leaves are an essential ingredient in Sambhar due to its distinct flavor.
Sambhar is best enjoyed with steamed rice, idli and dosa.

preface: I tasted this recipe with dosa at my friends place. Its hard to remember how many dosas I would have eaten then. I knew I had to learn this recipe that day and now I am sharing with you all.

ingredientList.measurementQuantity: 1/2 big finely chopped or cut lengthwise

procedureSteps.stepDescription: Wash dal till water runs clear. Let it soaked in water for 30 mins. Pressure cook Toor daal with green chillies, 1 chopped tomato and 3 cups of water for 3-4 whistles. I generally soak them in water for couple of hours to save time. Once done, wait until pressure is completely out. Carefully open the lid. Beat the dal using a whisk. If dal is not cooked, pressure cook for couple of whistles more.

Add vegetables of your choice ( carrots, beans, brinjal, drumsticks, okra, potatoes, radish) to the cooker and pressure cook it again for 1 whistle. Let it cool down. I usually pressure cook so that vegetables become soft. Do not pressure cook for more than 1 whistle, otherwise vegetables becomes mushy. In a separate pan, dry roast cumin and fenugreek seeds for 2 mins, once it cools down, make a fine powder and store in airtight container. This powder will be used as Sambhar Masala.

Meanwhile heat kadhai\wok and add oil. Once heated, add mustard seeds and allow it to splutter. After this, add curry leaves and red chilly, Saute for 10 sec. Be careful at this step as when curry leaves is put into hot oil, it splutters oil in all directions. So to be safer, cover atleast half of the kadai as soon as you add curry leaves.
Add asafoetida, fry for 2 sec, then add onions and fry until it becomes transparent. Sambhar tastes very food, if onions are fried properly.
Add Sambhar Masala Powder, fry for 1 min. Then add tomatoes.Fry till oil gets separated.

Soak tamarind in warm water for 30 mins. Now carefully open the pressure cooker, add fried masala to lentil or vice-versa. Add Tamarind juice. salt and bring lentil to boil.(add tamarind juice in small portion and keep tasting the lentil so that it does not become too sour as per your taste). Add salt as per taste.
Sambhar is ready, garnish with coriander leaves and enjoy it with rice,idly,dosa.

tips.tipDesc: You can use store bought Sambhar Masala as well instead of homemade masala
Use shallots instead of onions for enhanced taste.
You can also add seasoning of mustard seeds and curry leaves at the end, even if it is done earlier. This gives a distinct aroma to the dish.
